page.title: 17Glenogil gamekeeper(cont)
page.content: The Glenogil estate is the home of many red deer.In summer the deer are high in the hills and generally require little attention. However the keeper does watch over them, keeping a track of where there favorite feeding and watering spots are and looking out for sick animals. During winter and spring, when natural food is scarce, the keeper lays out hay and cattle-cake for the deer. During the shooting season in the autumn, sportsmen come to the estate from many countries to try their hand at "the sport of kings". The keeper takes his clients to places where he can be sure that a good, clean shot can be had. The sportsman can claim the head of his kill and have it mounted as a trophy. All the meat from any deer shot is sent to the local game dealer after skinning.
